title: Built From The Ground Up, A Layer At A Time

 A Layer At A Time

  physical_appearance: The image shows a photograph in black-and-white that is enclosed by a white frame. The foreground of the photograph captures the image of three male workers standing on a rooftop of a flat. One of them is standing on a wheelbarrow with two wheels and holding onto the handlebars. In front of him
 another worker is using a spade to work the ground. The background of the photograph shows several residential buildings
 all in the various stages of construction and completion.

  subject_terms_1: construction workers flats (apartments) residential structures rooftops urban development planned communities new towns (modern settlements) construction sites

  subject_terms_2: Black-and-white photography Construction workers Apartments Roofs Urban development Planned communities New towns Toa Payoh (Singapore) Building Singapore
 Housing and Development Board

  subject_terms_3: Photography Toa Payoh Housing Estate Singapore. Housing and Development Board

  sgcool_label_text: Loke Hong Seng (b. 1943) was working as a radio announcer with Radio Television Singapore in the 1960s when he picked up photography and subsequently grew to specialize in street photography. His images of 1960s and 1970s Singapore offer a candid view of everyday life in the early days of the nation’s development. This photograph shows workers at a HDB rooftop working on the construction of the Toa Payoh HDB new town. Newly constructed blocks can be seen in the background.
